document_data.caption: ''[[Fazrian]], the fallen planetar of [[Undermountain]].''
document_data.name: Dark Planetar
document_data.mainbody: '''Dark planetars''', also known as '''fallen planetars''',<ref name=W.DoMM-p293"> were [[planetar]]s, powerful [[celestial]]s from the [[upper planes]], who had fallen from the grace of their patron deity. Some were dragged down to the depths of the [[Abyss]], while others languished in the [[Prime Material plane]].<ref name=W.DoMM-p275">
document_data.Abilities: Dark planetars had access to both [[arcane magic|arcane]] and [[divine magic]] in their spellcasting portfolio. Among the spells they employed, were: ''[[flame strike]]'', ''[[symbol]]'', ''[[dispel magic]]'', ''[[heal]]'', ''[[globe of blades]]'', and ''[[unholy word]]'' among others.
document_data.Combat:
Like their still-celestial counterparts, dark planetars possessed inherent powers that made them terrific combatants.

They had inherent protections from all forms of physical damage, held resistances against to the elements, and near-immunity to all manners of [[spell]]s and [[magic]]al effects. Dark planetars could not be [[charm]]ed, [[confusion|confused]], or [[petrified]]. They were permanently ''[[haste]]d'' and ''[[regenerate]]d'' at double the rate of other beings with the same boon.
document_data.Possessions: Some dark planetars wielded powerful, ''+3 [[Item enchantment|enchanted]]'' [[greatsword]]s that had a chance to ''dispel magic'', nullify [[illusory]] creations, or even decapitate foes upon a landing a successful strike.
document_data.Ecology: It was possible to gate a dark planetar into existence by use of the spell, ''[[summon dark planetar]]''. This magic was only available to the most powerful, malevolent or [[neutral]]ly-aligned [[arcane spellcaster]]s.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1369}}, a number of dark planetars fell into the service of the powerful [[Bhaalist]] priestess, [[Amelyssan]] the Blackhearted.
document_data.Notable Dark Planetars:
* [[Fazrian]], a fallen planetar who served as the master of the [[Terminus Level]] of [[Undermountain]].
* [[The Winged]], the leader of the [[Planar Hunters]] and servant of [[Szass Tam]].
